data.name: InterruptEngineEvent
desc: describes an interrupt which occurs in the scripting engine.

items.name: Name
desc: fully qualified name to address the module or function affected by the event that took place.
If the module or function can't be addressed by name (for example, in case that a runtime-generated eval-module is executed), this string is empty.

items.name: SourceCode
desc: source code of the Module affected by the event that took place.
If the source can be accessed using the ModuleName, or if the source is unknown (executing compiled code), this string can be empty.

items.name: StartLine
desc: contains the first line in the module's source code that is affected by the event that took place.

If \"name\" addresses a function, all line and column values are nevertheless given relative to the module's source. If source code is not available, this value addresses a binary position in the compiled code.

items.name: StartColumn
desc: contains the first column in the \"StartLine\" that is affected by the event that took place.

items.name: EndLine
desc: contains the last line in the module's source code that is affected by the event that took place.

items.name: EndColumn
desc: contains the first column in the \"EndLine\" which is NOT affected by the event that took place.

items.name: ErrorMessage
desc: Only valid if Reason is RuntimeError or CompileError.
